xwikidoc.name: Translations

xwikidoc.title: Translations
xwikidoc.content:
application.urlnormalizer.document.saveComment=Normalize links
# Administration admin.urlnormalizer=URL Normalizer urlnormalizer.admin.sectionTitle=URL Normalizer
urlnormalizer.admin.filters.title=Filters urlnormalizer.admin.filters.description=The URL normalizer is automatically converting URL known to point to wiki pages into internal wiki links, but sometimes you don't want the default behavior or there is no way to know from the standard configuration that the URL is in fact targeting a wiki page (for example if there is a redirect to a wiki page behind this URL). For those use cases, you can define filters in charge of matching a link and converting its reference to something else.
urlnormalizer.admin.normalize=Normalize urlnormalizer.admin.createNewVersions=Create a new document version upon normalization urlnormalizer.admin.createNewVersions.hint=Defines if a new version of the document should appear in the history when performing the normalization. urlnormalizer.admin.createNewVersionYes=Yes urlnormalizer.admin.createNewVersionNo=No urlnormalizer.admin.submit=Start normalization
URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_sourceType=Source type URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_sourceType_hint=The type of the link to convert (url, path, etc.) URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_sourceReference=Source reference pattern URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_sourceReference_hint=The regular expression matching pattern to use to match the reference of the link to convert URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_targetType=Target type URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_targetType_hint=The type of the resulting link (doc, page, etc.) URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_targetReference=Target reference URLNormalizer.Code.FilterClass_targetReference_hint=The regular expression result pattern to use to produce reference of the resulting link
